intro: Galiastrum, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to Central and South America and are characterized by their showy, often orange or yellow flowers. Galiastrum species typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies.
